definition: to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
to respect/to venerate/to salute/to offer

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation

sentences.english: Respect the elders, love juniors , save all with mercy, care for others.
sentences.chinese: 敬老尊賢，愛護後進，慈悲渡衆，關懷他人。

sentences.english: Reverence for elders and veneration for virtuous ones has always been a wholesome tradition in China.
sentences.chinese: “敬老尊賢”一直是中國的優良傳統。
